wikipedia_page.main:
Maire Yvonne Owen (28 July 1923–December 1990) was a British stage and film actress.Born in London in 1923, she was married to Alan Badel for 40 years; they had a daughter Sarah.In 1946 she appeared in the West End melodrama But for the Grace of God by Frederick Lonsdale.
She died in Chichester in December 1990, aged 67. [1]

response: * Yvonne Owen as Betty, the Martins' other servant and Charles's girlfriend
Badel married the actress Yvonne Owen in 1942 and they remained married until his death from a heart attack in Chichester, aged 58. Their daughter Sarah Badel is an actress.
|Someone at the Door || Francis Searle || Garry Marsh, Yvonne Owen || Comedy crime ||
Sarah M. Badel (born 30 March 1943) is a retired British stage and film actress. She is the daughter of actors Alan Badel and Yvonne Owen.
Someone at the Door is a 1950 British crime comedy film directed by Francis Searle and starring Michael Medwin, Garry Marsh and Yvonne Owen.

link_mentions.page: But for the Grace of God (play)
response: But for the Grace of God is a play by the British writer Frederick Lonsdale. A murder melodrama, different from his standard light comedies, it ran for 203 performances at St James's Theatre in the West End between 3 September 1946 and 1 March 1947. The original cast included Michael Gough, A.E. Matthews, Mary Jerrold and Yvonne Owen.Wearing p.256
